_header: Come no more at our house
_description: Song of which only a reference to its burden(?) or refrain(?) survives — two lines

Shillingford.Transcription: Come no more at our houscome come come
Shillingford.Note:
Quoted as a ‘myry song’ that John Shillingford sang as he
                    wrote lying on his bed in London early in the morning.
Shillingford.Editions:
Moore,  Stuart A.,
                        ed.  
             Letters and Papers of John Shillingford, Mayor of Exeter
                1447-50.
Camden Society
         n. s. 11. 1871: 16.
